# UnitIlluminance

**Class**

A unit of measure for illuminance.

## Declaration

```swift
class UnitIlluminance
```

## Overview

You typically use instances of [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/UnitIlluminance] to represent specific quantities of illuminance using the [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSMeasurement] class.

### Illuminance

Illuminance is the luminous flux incident on a surface. The SI unit for illuminance is the lux (lx), which is derived as one lumen per square meter (1lm / 1m2).

The [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/UnitIlluminance] class defines its [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/Dimension/baseUnit()] as [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/UnitIlluminance/lux].



## Accessing the Base Unit

- **baseUnit()**: Returns the base unit.

## Accesing Predefined Units

- **lux**: The lux unit of illuminance.

## Energy, Heat, and Light

- **UnitEnergy**: A unit of measure for energy.
- **UnitPower**: A unit of measure for power.
- **UnitTemperature**: A unit of measure for temperature.
